thread.title: Steven Wilson Shares First Music From New Album [News]
thread.title_full: Steven Wilson Shares First Music From New Album [News]

title: Steven Wilson Shares First Music From New Album [News]
text: Steven Wilson Shares First Music From New Album A work-in-progress clip of a song called "Pariah," featuring Ninet Tayeb on guest vocals. UG News editor since early 2013. King Crimson fan. I handle the news around here. Posted 14 hours ago 7 Steven Wilson posted a brief clip from the studio, presenting the very first sample of fresh music from his upcoming, yet-untitled new studio album.Titled "Pariah," the video features a vocal duet of Steven and Ninet Tayeb, who conributed vocal parts on " Routine " and " Ancestral " tracks off Wilson's previous album, 2015's " Hand. Cannot. Erase. "Steven noted: "Happy new year folks! Here's a short clip of myself and the amazing Ninet Tayeb recording vocals for the song 'Pariah' from the new album in progress, written especially for us to record as a duet. Co-producer/engineer Paul Stacey is also in the clip, filmed by Lasse Hoile earlier this week. More studio stuff soon!"As previously reported, the new record will be Mr. Wilson's first studio effort not to feature Guthrie Govan on guitar and Marco Minnemann on drums since 2011's " Grace for Drowning ." The new members are drummer Craig Blundell and guitarist Dave Kilminster. You can read more about the new lineup here , the latest studio clip awaits below.
